data.fullContent: In 1969, the computer network that later became known as the Internet was built by the Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA) of the U.S. Department of Defense. Today, the Internet is a vast collection of computer networks around the world and can be accessed via the user's computer or cell phone. The cornerstone technology that enables it to function is known as TCP/IP (Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol). The Internet is a very important part of communications today because it allows people to exchange information anywhere in the world using email. One of the most popular applications for email is known as instant messaging, which allows individuals to exchange information in real time by sending each other messages on their computers from anywhere in the world. The Internet has changed the way many people communicate. It has become a valuable part of business, education, and social interaction.

q1.translation: 1969年，美国国防部高级研究计划局(ARPA)建立了后来被称为因特网的计算机网络。今天，因特网是世界各地计算机网络的巨大集合，可以通过用户的计算机或手机访问。使其发挥作用的基础技术被称为TCP/IP(传输控制协议/互联网协议)。互联网是当今通信中非常重要的一部分，因为它允许人们在世界任何地方使用电子邮件交换信息。电子邮件最流行的应用之一被称为即时消息，它允许个人在世界上任何地方的电脑上互相发送消息，从而实时交换信息。

Today, the Internet is a vast collection of computer networks around the world and can be accessed via the user's computer or cell phone. The cornerstone technology that enables it to function is known as TCP/IP (Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol). The Internet is a very important part of communications today because it allows people to exchange information anywhere in the world using email. One of the most popular applications for email is known as instant messaging, which allows individuals to exchange information in real time by sending each other messages on their computers from anywhere in the world.

Today, the Internet is a vast collection of computer networks around the world and can be ____ via the user's computer or cell ____. The cornerstone technology that enables it to function is known as TCP/IP (Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol). The Internet is a ____ important part of communications today because it allows ____ to exchange information anywhere in the world using email. One of the ____ popular applications for email is ____ as instant messaging, which allows individuals to exchange information in real time ____ sending each other messages on their computers from anywhere in the ____.

Today, the Internet is a vast collection of computer networks around the world and can be accessed via the user's computer or cell phone. The cornerstone technology that enables it to function is known as TCP/IP (Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol). The Internet is a very important part of communications today because it allows people to exchange information anywhere in the world using email.
